Cases reported from Village Porkulam, HSC Mangad, PHC Porkulam, Block Pazhanji. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 02 lab samples collected sent to DMO’H lab Thrissur; result awaited. All cases treated symptomatically. Chlorination done. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Paruthiyara, PHC Veliyam, Block- Kottarakara (CHC Nedumoncavu) due to consumption of contaminated water from well. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Active house to house survey done. 11 blood samples collected which showed increased serum bilirubin. Chlorination of water sources done. Health education given regarding safe drinking water.

Cases reported from Village Pudukinaru, PHC Anandapuram, and Block Sattangulam due to consumption of contaminated water. District RRT investigated the outbreak. 13 serum samples collected out of which 4 tested positive showing increased bilirubin. House to House fever survey done. Chlorination of water sources done. Health education regarding proper water handling done.

Cases reported from Villages Mala, SC Kuzhikattussery, and PHC Aloor. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Serum sample collected sent to District laboratory, result awaited. House to house survey done. Chlorination of water sources done. IEC activities undertaken regarding safe drinking water.

Cases reported from Kottarakara, Veliyam, Paruthiyara probably due to consumption of contaminated water from public well. District RRT visited the affected area and investigated the outbreak. Super chlorination of wells done. Active surveillance done. Serum sample tested at Kottarakara revealed raised serum bilirubin. Active survey done to find new cases. All cases treated. Chlorine tablets distributed in the locality. Leakage in water pipeline repaired. Health education given regarding hygiene and sanitation.

Outbreak of jaundice reported from Tel Factory, Baran. There has been no water purification or bleaching done for long time and there is pipe line leakage at several points. Two medical teams were deputed to the affected area to conduct health camp and door to door survey. Cases given medical treatment and severely ill cases referred to District Hospital. 15 water samples collected from affected area; result awaited. Chlorine tablets distributed in the colony. PHED requested to do chlorination of water sources. Health education given regarding hygiene and sanitation.

Cases of fever with jaundice reported from Village Banamalipur, Mahatapalla & Raipur, SC Bajpur, CHC Haladia. District RRT visited the affected area and investigated the outbreak. 6 blood samples and 2 water samples collected and sent for lab analysis; result awaited. IEC activities undertaken regarding safe drinking water and hygienic practices.

Cases with fever and jaundice reported from Raajan Mohalla, Kothi Road, Nawanshahr. Serum and water samples taken of suspected patients of affected area and sent for lab analysis; result awaited. All cases treated symptomatically. Active survey done in the affected area. Chlorine tablets distributed. IEC activities undertaken and health education given.

Cases reported from urban area Patel Chowk, Krishna Nagar – Bajri company, of District Gurdaspur, due to contaminated water. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Medical camp organized in the affected area and treatment of patients done symptomatically. 8 serum samples collected out of which 2 samples are positive for Hepatitis A and 1 sample for Hepatitis E (Ig M ELISA). Chlorination of water sources done. IEC activities undertaken regarding safe drinking water.

Cases reported from Villages Kotli Than Singh and Patara, Block Jamsher Khas of District Jalandhar. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Serum sample collected and result awaited. Symptomatic treatment of patients done. All cases treated. Chlorination of water sources done. IEC activities undertaken regarding safe drinking water, hygienic practices and sanitation measures.

Cases reported from Urban area of District Rajgarh. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Active surveillance done for cases by house to house visit. Serum sample tested at District Hospital revealed raised serum bilirubin. Block health team visited the affected area and treated all cases symptomatically. Health education given regarding safe drinking water, hygienic practices and sanitation measures.

Outbreak reported from Village Shayam Garh and Melkheda town ward no, 1,2,3 and 4, District Mandsaur. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Temporary medical camps organized. Serum sample tested revealed raised serum bilirubin. Symptomatic treatment of patients done. Chlorination of water sources done. IEC activities undertaken regarding safe drinking water, hygienic practices and sanitation measures.

Outbreak reported from Village Yeroor, PHC yeroor, Block Anchal, District Kollam. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Temporary medical camps organized. House to house survey done for finding new cases. Out of 10 serum sample 2 were positive for Hepatitis A (Ig M ELISA). Symptomatic treatment of patients done. Chlorination of water sources done. IEC activities undertaken regarding safe drinking water, hygienic practices and sanitation measures.

Cases reported from Village Dhakki Mohalla (Ward No. 25), Block Pathankot, District Gurdaspur. District RRT investigated the outbreak. 11 serum samples collected and sent to Microbiology Dept., GMC, Amritsar; result awaited. House to house survey conducted for new cases. Chlorination of drinking water supply done in the village. Health education given regarding hygiene, sanitation and safe drinking water.

Outbreak reported from Manit college, City Bhopal, District Bhopal due to consumption of contaminated water. District RRT investigated the outbreak. All cases treated symptomatically. 15 serum samples collected out of which 10 samples showed increased serum Bilirubin. Chlorination of water sources done. IEC activities done regarding safe drinking water and sanitation.

Cases reported from Village Dhakki, Block Pathankot, District Gurdaspur. District RRT visited the area and investigated the outbreak. 11 serum samples taken and tested for Hepatitis A and E. Out of these, 7 tested positive for Hepatitis E and 2 for both Hepatitis A and E both. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Mareda, SC Sametra, PHC Mitha, Block Becharaji, District Mahesana. District RRT investigated the outbreak. 8 serum sample taken for identification of Hepatitis A and E and sent to G.H. Mahesana; result awaited. House to house surveillance done in the affected area. Chlorination and sanitation activities conducted. Pipe line leakage repair activity was performed. Preventive measures have been geared up. IEC activities done.

Cases reported from Villages Sobari and Naharbari, SC Bormothauri, PHC Dhemaji, Block Dhemaji, District Dhemaji. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Serum samples collected and sent to Microbiology Department, AMCH (Assam Medical College & Hospital). Laboratory has reported that the samples cannot be tested as they are spoiled. House to house survey done for finding new cases. Medical camp organized in the area. Awareness meeting organized in the affected villages.

Outbreak reported from Village Padinarathra, SC Varambetta, PHC Kappukunnu, Block Kalpetta, District Wayanad. District RRT investigated the outbreak. 10 serum samples collected and sent to Distinct lab; result awaited. Chlorination of water sources done. Temporary medical camp organized in the affected area. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Madanpur, Block Chalheri, District Patiala possibly due to contamination of drinking water. District RRT visited the area and investigated outbreak. Blood, water, and stool samples collected and sent for testing. On serological testing, 4 out of 7 samples tested positive for Hepatitis – A by ELISA. All samples tested negative for Hepatitis – E by ELISA. Medical camp organized and medicines distributed to affected patients. ORS packets distributed. IEC activities done.

Cases reported from Village Pandikkad, PHC Pandikkad, Block Wandoor, District Malappuram possibly due to consumption of contaminated water. Health inspector and JHI visited the area and investigated the outbreak. It was found that all the affected participated in a wedding reception at Vilangampoyil Madarasa about one and half month ago. 13 wells in the locality chlorinated. Awareness drive conducted in the madarsa and surrounding localities. 6 serum samples taken and sent to PKM Hospital, Pandikkad and to Neo Hospital, Pandikkad. Results showed high bilirubin in all samples. IEC activities done.

Cases reported from village Vazhayoor, PHC Vazhayoor, Block Omanoor, Ward (Geographical Area) Ellathupuraye. District & Block medical teams visited the area and investigated the outbreak. 4 Serum samples taken for determination of bilirubin levels. All 4 samples were found to have high levels of bilirubin (5.1, 6.2, 8.1, and 8.2). Viral serology could not be done due to lack of adequate testing facilities in the area. A clinical diagnosis of viral hepatitis was made by physicians of the medical teams. Health education and IEC activities done.

Cases reported from Village Muksara, PHC Siswal, CHC Kajlan, District Hisar. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Serum samples collected for analysis; results awaited. Alternate water supply from tanker arranged by public health department. Chlorination of water sources done. Health education given.

Cases reported from District Chamoli, Block Dewal, Villages Icholi, Sirkot and Koni possibly due to consumption of contaminated drinking water. Most cases had attended a marriage function. District RRT visited the affected area. Medical treatment provided to all patients. 18 serum samples collected and sent to District Hospital Chamoli out of which 14 samples showed increased serum Bilirubin. Chlorination of water sources done by Jal Sansthan. People advised to use boiled water for drinking purpose. Health education given.

Outbreak reported from Block Ghumarwin, district Bilaspur. Cases presented with symptoms of fever, jaundice, nausea and anorexia. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Monitoring of water sources and supply in the community done. House to house survey done. Chlorine tablets distributed in the community. Cases were in the age group between 13-18 years. 13 samples collected and sent to IGMC Shimla; all samples were negative for HAV, HEV. 12 samples sent to NCDC, all were negative for HCV, HEV. Samples tested negative for Scrub typhus and Leptospirosis. IEC activities done through local newspaper.

Cases reported from CHC Ramgarh (10 cases) and Emergency Hospital Vijaypur (49 cases), Block Ramgarh, District Samba possibly due to consumption of contaminated water. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Cases treated at CHC Ramgarh and Emergency Hospital Vijaypur. 59 blood samples collected which showed increased Serum Bilirubin. 3 water samples collected and sent to GMC Jammu which were found unsatisfactory for drinking purpose. Chlorine tablets distributed in the affected areas at SC/PHC/CHC level. PHE Department intimated to repair the leakage in water pipelines and ensure that chlorinated water is supplied to the public. People were advised to avoid defecation near water sources. Health education given regarding safe drinking water, personal hygiene, cleanliness and sanitation.

Outbreak reported from Village& PHC Nilambur, Block Chungathara, district Malapuram. Medical team investigated the outbreak. SGOT of all the cases were raised. All cases treated locally. Chlorination of water sources done. Health education given.

Outbreak reported from Village Teppakkulam UHP, SC & PHC Tiruchirappalli, Block Trichy, District Trichy. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Out of 47 serum samples collected, 27 samples showed raise in bilirubin levels and the above samples sent to KAVP Medical College for further analysis; result awaited.

Cases reported from Village Kaduthuruthy, Block Thalayolaparambu, Distrcit Kottayam. Distrcit RRT Team investigatig the outbreak. House to house survey done. All cases had raised serum bilirubin. Chlorination of water sources done. Health education regarding personal hygiene and sanitation imparted.

Cases reported from Village Kooropada, SC Kothala, PHC Kooropada, Distrcit Kottayam. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Serum bilirubin was raised in all the cases. Chlorination of water sources done. Bit notices were distributed in the community. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Punnapra, SC Punnapra, PHC Punnapra, Block Ambalappuzha, District Alappuzha. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Serum samples collected from the cases showed raised bilirubin levels. Serum samples collected and sent to NIV, Alappuzha; result awaited. Chlorination of water sources done. Awareness of drinking boiling water imparted in the community. Health education regarding personal hygiene and sanitation imparted.

Cases reported from Village Masangaon, Block Kot, District Pauri. District RRT and Block health team visited the affected area. House to house survey done. Symptomatic treatment given to cases. 12 serum samples collected & sent to Govt. Medical college Pauri Garhwal which tested negative for Hepatitis A & E. IEC done regarding water & food hygiene and sanitation.

Cases of jaundice reported from Village Vengapally, SC Puzhamudi, PHC Vengapally, Block Thariode, District Wayanad. Medical team investigated the outbreak. All cases were inmates of a religious institution. Cases treated locally. Serum samples collected; result awaited. Chlorination of water sources done. Health education given.

Cases of jaundice reported from Village Bobde Takli, PHC Zari, Block and District Parbhani. District RRT investigated the outbreak. People consumed water from a well. Cases treated at local health centre. 2 deaths occurred in pregnant women who were positive for Hepatitis E. Chlorination of water sources done in the locality. 9 blood samples collected and sent to Civil Hospital, Parbhani; result awaited. Health education given regarding safe drinking water, hygiene and sanitation.

Outbreak of jaundice reported from Village Dhandhusan, PHC Kherva, District Mahesana. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done by para medical team. Cases treated at local health centre. All 18 blood samples collected and sent to PHC Kherva which showed increased serum bilirubin. Chlorine tablets distributed in the community. Inspection for pipeline leakage done. People advised to consume boiled water for drinking purpose.

Cases of jaundice reported from Village Babara, PHC Zazam, Block Santalpur, District Patan. Block health team investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Cases treated locally. Chlorine tablets distributed in the locality. IEC done regarding safe drinking water and sanitation.

Cases reported from Durlabh Nagar And Kang Mohalla, Samrala. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Active case search conducted. A total of 04 blood samples collected and sent to DPHL, Ludhiana. A total of 05 water samples collected result awaited. All cases treated. Chlorine pellets distributed in the affected area. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Jawali Ward No. 6,7,8. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey conducted. Lab samples collected and sent to Microbiology lab result awaited. All cases treated. Chlorination done. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Banimulla, Block Kulgam. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 06 blood samples and 03 Water samples sent to Public Health Lab, Barzulla, result awaited. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.
Outbreak reported from Dhari Block due to consumption of polluted water. District RRT visited the affected area. All cases treated. IEC activities were under taken.

Outbreak reported from Sector-12 among resident doctors of Post Graduate Institute of Medical Education and Research, Chandigarh due to consumption of contaminated fruit juice or salad. Water samples collected for lab analysis being tested at the Institute; result awaited.

Outbreak reported from Kotabagh Block due to consumption of contaminated water. People advised to use safe portable and boiled water. Chlorine tablets distributed. Water samples found contaminated on testing. Stool samples sent for lab analysis; result awaited.

Outbreak reported from East Chettakandi, Kallikandi, PHC Triprangottur under CHC Panoor. Cases presented with fever and jaundice. Investigation done by District RRT. House to house survey done for new cases. Serum bilirubin levels found elevated. Serological test done and water samples collected for bacteriological examination; reports awaited. Chlorination and disinfection of water sources done.

5 new cases with fever, jaundice, vomiting and anorexia reported from Ward-IX of Athirampuzha panachayat. District RRT with epidemiologist investigated the outbreak. Water sample on analysis at Kottayam Medical College, found unsuitable for drinking purpose. Medical camp conducted and house to house survey done for new cases. Chlorination of well water done. Health education given regarding sanitation and hygiene, and people instructed to use boiled water for drinking.

Cases of jaundice reported from Tarjang village, Makuakateni sub- centre, PHC Birasal under Kankadahad block. District RRT visited the affected area. Chlorination and disinfection of water sources and storage tanks done. Health education given regarding sanitation, hygiene and importance of drinking boiled water.

Outbreak reported from BITS Pilani Goa Campus at Vasco on 23.09.09. RRT along with Medical Officer of BITS Pilani investigated the outbreak in the area. Water samples collected for lab analysis; result awaited. Disinfection and chlorination of drinking water sources done. Kitchen staff advised to maintain sanitation and hygiene. All residents advised regarding personal hygiene and use of boiled water for drinking. IEC activities undertaken.

Cases reported from Toka Village, Raipur rani. Medical Team visited the village. District malaria officer instructed for fogging. 96 MP slide prepared and sent for examination found negative. Medical incharge PHC Kot has been directed to keep watch on situation. 675 tablets of chloroquine distributed
